## How to visually check continuous variables?{.center}

## Histograms

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| output-location: default

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)

data("penguins")
penguins %>% 
group_by(species) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=bill_length_mm, color=species, fill=species))+
  geom_histogram()

```

## Boxplots

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| output-location: column

library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)

data("penguins")
penguins %>% 
group_by(species) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=species, 
             y=bill_length_mm, 
             color=species, 
             fill=species))+
  geom_boxplot(alpha=0.5)+
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=16),
        axis.title=element_text(size=16))

```

- This is not mining

## Check distributions

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| output-location: column

penguins %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  pivot_longer(bill_length_mm:body_mass_g, names_to = "trait") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=value,
         group=species,
         fill=species,
         color=species))+
  geom_density(alpha=0.7)+
  facet_grid(~trait, scales = "free_x" )+
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=16),
        axis.title=element_text(size=16))+
  theme_minimal()

```

## Checking via histogram

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| output-location: column
set.seed(999)
normal<-rnorm(100)
normal %>% 
  as.tibble() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(value))+
  geom_histogram(color="#DD4A48", fill="#DD4A48")+
  geom_vline(xintercept=c(mean(normal), (mean(normal)+sd(normal)),mean(normal)-sd(normal)), 
             linetype="dashed")

```

## Checking via bokplot

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| output-location: column
set.seed(999)
normal<-rnorm(100)
normal %>% 
  as.tibble() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(value))+
  geom_boxplot(fill="#DD4A48",alpha=0.7)

```
